#Text=Makarska
#Text=Makarska is the main beach resort town along the Makarska Riviera in Croatia , south of Split .
#Text=Behind the city the impressive Biokovo mountain range rises up to 1,700 m ( 5,575 ft ) within a few kilometres from the sea .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Makarska is on the picturesque Croatian coast .
#Text=It is recommended to visit from April until October .
#Text=For younger people July and August .
#Text=If you want take a rest with no crowd on the beach then September is a good time .
#Text=Makarska is a good place to stay rather than visiting on a day trip .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The nearest airport is Split SPU , 60 km north .
#Text=In summer this has frequent package flights from north Europe and most visitors to the Makarska Riviera arrive this way .
#Text=To the south is Dubrovnik DBV with even more seasonal flights .
#Text=It 's 160 km south and you have to cross Neum in Bosnia for all of 10 mins to reach the rest of Croatia including Makarska .
#Text=If you hire a car , they 'll charge extra for taking the car out of Croatia , and apply that charge to every day of the hire even if you only have the short Neum transit there and back .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Regular regional bus service connects Makarska to Split , Dubrovnik , and other cities in the region .
#Text=June-August there 's an overnight direct bus to Banja Luka and Gradiska in the north of Bosnia .
#Text=By boat
#Text=A ferry sails to Sumartin on Brac island , taking 30 min .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=In Makarska
#Text=there is no single large taxi company , but many small operators provide a service with one or two cars .
#Text=The taxi usually comes within 10 to 15 min from the call .
#Text=See
#Text=You can take a scenic walk around the peninsula , the marina , and the main square .
#Text=The peninsula area in particular is scenic , relaxing , and some parts are not too crowded .
#Text=Be warned that nude sunbathers like to relax on the southern side of the peninsula .
#Text=Do
#Text=Parasailing
#Text=Rafting and kayaking .
#Text=About a half-hour drive from Makarska , you can go rafting or kayaking along the Cetina River .
#Text=The river is generally calm , although there are a few fast places , and one section is particularly dangerous .
#Text=There is a tour agency that offers guided trips down the river .
#Text=If you decide to go , look for the cave that was used by Marshal Tito 's Partisans to hide from the Nazis during World War II .
#Text=Trekking .
#Text=The mountains directly behind the city have decent hiking trails .
#Text=The area is scenic and not too crowded , and you can get a good view of Makarska if you hike high enough .
#Text=Be sure to stay on the trails and be aware that there is a species of poisonous snake that lives in the area .
#Text=Nature Park Biokovo .

#Text=The mountain that rises right out of the sea , behind Makarska , with its peaks and lookout points that afford unforgettable panoramic views onto the Makarska Riviera and the area around Biokovo .

#Text=Biokovo is unique not only for its position , but also for its geomorphology and its biological diversity , which are the main reasons for Mt Biokovo having been proclaimed a nature park in 1981 .
#Text=You can walk on foot into the mountains behind Makarska , however if you want to reach the best mountainous areas you will need to drive to the official park itself .
#Text=There are excellent hiking opportunities in the park , although sometimes the fog makes it difficult to have a good view of the surroundings .
#Text=Kotišina Botanical Garden , a part of the Nature park Biokovo that covers an area of 16.5 ha over the village of Kotišina .
#Text=According to the intentions of its founder , Fra Jure Radić , the Biokovo vegetation , preserved in its original state , enables visitors to get to know the unique wild plant life of the area .
#Text=Buy
#Text=At the southern end of the beach ( near the peninsula ) , there is an outdoor market area .
#Text=There you can buy souvenirs , beach gear , and food .
#Text=In this area are other simple but fun attractions such as trampolines to jump on .
#Text=There are also several well-stocked supermarkets in town , including a branch of the German discounter Lidl .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are many restaurants along the beach and in the main square area , but often mediocre and tourist-trappy .
#Text=Recommended are :
#Text=Ivo , Ul .
#Text=Ante Starčevića 41 , Makarska .
#Text=Good unpretentious fare .
#Text=Jež , Ul . Kralja Petra Krešimira IV 90 , Makarska .
#Text=Mediterranean restaurant , good for seafood and meat dishes .
#Text=Kalelarga , Kalalarga 40 , Makarska .
#Text=Good fresh seafood , slow service so make a night of it .
#Text=" You never know what you 'll be eating " said one reviewer , who enjoyed the donkey in red wine .
#Text=Restoran Herc , Šetalište Dr. Franje Tuđmana , Makarska .
#Text=Good food and service .
#Text=Riva ( Vinc-Mornar ) , Obala kralja Tomislava 6a , Makarska ( on harbour quay ) .
#Text=Good sea-food restaurant .
#Text=Busy people , they also run Café Bar Nautica , Pizzeria Centrum , a couple of villas , and a motor launch .
#Text=Susvid , Trg fra Andrije Kačića Miošića 8 , Makarska .
#Text=24 hours .
#Text=Seafood and steakhouse .
#Text=They also own Peskera restaurant .
#Text=Jeny , Čovići , Tucepi ( in hills above Tucepi , follow S12 ) , ☏ +385915878078 .
#Text=Good restaurant especially the 5-7 course tasting menus - but expensive , and they only take cash .
#Text=Konoba Veza , Srida Sela 1 , Gornje Tucepi ( in hills , follow S12 ) , ☏ +38521623224 .
#Text=Tu - Su 12:00 - 23:00 , M 18:00-23:00. Good traditional restaurant up the hill above Tucepi .
#Text=Drink
#Text=There are bars and cafes along the main strip of the beach .
#Text=Most of the best dance clubs are concentrated around the marina .
#Text=During the high tourist season ( July to September ) , the Grotta and the Deep are two popular dance bars that have been built into a natural cave along the sea .
#Text=Grotta .
#Text=Closed during the off-season .
#Text=Bar and dance club in a sea-side grotto .
#Text=Deep .
#Text=Closed during the off-season .
#Text=Bar and dance club in a sea-side grotto .
#Text=Budget
#Text=Hostel Makarska Subtub , Prvosvibanjska 15 ( one block back from harbour ) , ☏ +38521615372 .
#Text=Check-in : 12:00 , check-out : 10:00 .
#Text=First backpackers ' hostel in Makarska .
#Text=It is in a safe , quiet neighborhood .
#Text=Peaceful , clean hostel with friendly atmosphere .
#Text=It is run by a traveller who can give you all the info you need about Croatia .
#Text=With dorms and en suite private rooms .
#Text=Dorm € 30 ppn .
